com.google.maps

Class GeoApiContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.maps.GeoApiContext

  • public class GeoApiContext
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point for making requests against the Google Geo APIs.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  GeoApiContext.RequestHandler
      RequestHandler is the service provider interface that enables requests to be handled via switchable back ends.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeoApiContext()
      Construct a GeoApiContext with OkHttp.
      GeoApiContext(GeoApiContext.RequestHandler requestHandler)
      Construct a GeoApiContext with the specified strategy for handling requests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeoApiContext

        public GeoApiContext()
        Construct a GeoApiContext with OkHttp.

      • GeoApiContext

        public GeoApiContext(GeoApiContext.RequestHandler requestHandler)
        Construct a GeoApiContext with the specified strategy for handling requests.
        Parameters:
        requestHandler - How to handle URL requests to the Google Maps APIs.
        See Also:
        OkHttpRequestHandler, GaeRequestHandler

    • Method Detail

      • setApiKey

        public GeoApiContext setApiKey(java.lang.String apiKey)

      • setEnterpriseCredentials

        public GeoApiContext setEnterpriseCredentials(java.lang.String clientId,
                                              java.lang.String cryptographicSecret)

      • setChannel

        public GeoApiContext setChannel(java.lang.String channel)
        Sets the default channel for requests (can be overridden by requests). Only useful for Google Maps for Work clients.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to use for analytics

      • setConnectTimeout

        public GeoApiContext setConnectTimeout(long timeout,
                                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the default connect timeout for new connections. A value of 0 means no timeout.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.setConnectTimeout(int)

      • setReadTimeout

        public GeoApiContext setReadTimeout(long timeout,
                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the default read timeout for new connections. A value of 0 means no timeout.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.setReadTimeout(int)

      • setWriteTimeout

        public GeoApiContext setWriteTimeout(long timeout,
                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the default write timeout for new connections. A value of 0 means no timeout.

      • setRetryTimeout

        public GeoApiContext setRetryTimeout(long timeout,
                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the cumulative time limit for which retry-able errors will be retried. Defaults to 60 seconds. Set to zero to retry requests forever.

        This operates separately from the count-based setMaxRetries(Integer).

      • setMaxRetries

        public GeoApiContext setMaxRetries(java.lang.Integer maxRetries)
        Sets the maximum number of times each retry-able errors will be retried. Set this to null to not have a max number. Set this to zero to disable retries.

        This operates separately from the time-based setRetryTimeout(long, TimeUnit).

      • disableRetries

        public GeoApiContext disableRetries()
        Disable retries completely.

      • setQueryRateLimit

        public GeoApiContext setQueryRateLimit(int maxQps)
        Sets the maximum number of queries that will be executed during a 1 second interval. The default is 10. A minimum interval between requests will also be enforced, set to 1/(2 * maxQps).

      • setQueryRateLimit

        public GeoApiContext setQueryRateLimit(int maxQps,
                                       int minimumInterval)
        Sets the rate at which queries are executed.
        Parameters:
        maxQps - The maximum number of queries to execute per second.
        minimumInterval - The minimum amount of time, in milliseconds, to pause between requests. Note that this pause only occurs if the amount of time between requests has not elapsed naturally.

      • toggleifExceptionIsAllowedToRetry

        public GeoApiContext toggleifExceptionIsAllowedToRetry(java.lang.Class<? extends ApiException> exception,
                                                       boolean allowedToRetry)
        Allows specific API exceptions to be retried or not retried.

      • setProxy

        public GeoApiContext setProxy(java.net.Proxy proxy)
        Sets the proxy for new connections.
        Parameters:
        proxy - The proxy to be used by the underlying HTTP client.
